attributes.action: The government to underwrite 100% of the UK's living costs whilst Covid-19 exits
attributes.additional_details: We need to submerse the UK in to a cryogenic type state until a vaccine is readily available to use. Why is this so? Unfortunately no matter what type of program we follow the virus is unlikely to just go away. There is the constant threat that the virus will take a hold again or indeed re-infect those who have already suffered from it. Unless we can be confident that we can go about our everyday lives, that key word “CONFIDENCE” will prevent us from recovering.
attributes.background: If the Gov 100% underwrote peoples livelihoods based upon their earnings over the past 3 years there will be no need for the public to venture out to spread the virus. Not company profits, just incomes. We mothball non-essential businesses and only keep the “ESSENTIAL” businesses functioning.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to change how it's supporting people during the coronavirus outbreak, but it's not clear exactly what you want the Government to do.

If you want the Government to protect the income of workers during the outbreak, you might like to sign these petitions:

Ensure employees are paid their full wage if they can't work due to coronavirus: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301652

Pay self employed workers a wage due to lack of earnings caused by COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303345

We have published a number of petitions calling on the Government to provide financial support to individuals and businesses during the pandemic, which you might like to sign. You can view all open petitions relating to coronavirus here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=covid-19

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
